Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2013 05:26PM NY_Lisa wrote: I hit submit too quickly......... Thank you to anyone that has any input in this!
Posts.Title: ADH Biopsy Surgery coming Up :-( NY_Lisa SueInMN

Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2013 08:26PM NY_Lisa wrote: Your response & advice mean alot to me! I've been through alot in the past 6 months...my mom diagnosed with stage 4 lung & bone cancer, I had shoulder surgery, a hysterectomy & now all of this!  Having to go back for the 2nd biopsy threw me for a loop!  Wasn't expecting to have to do that.  And having an MRI guided biopsy was very uncomfortable & a long process.  Plus dealing with all the insurance through all of this isn't fun either!  But I'm staying positive.  I had 2 close friends diagnosed with BC in 2012 & i'm very proactive in my health.  I'm a long time BC supporter, I even walked the 30.3 miles for the Avon BC Walk this past October & I'm already signed up to do it again this fall!!! I just don't like the unknown & can't wait til all procedures are done & results are in! Thank you & best health to you also!
Posts.Title: ADH Biopsy Surgery coming Up :-( NY_Lisa SueInMN

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2013 01:53PM NY_Lisa wrote: Sue! Your situation sounds so similar to mine!! I've been going back & forth for 8 weeks already!  I just want this taken care of!  Thank you for sharing your journey with me.  I'm not much for taking vicodin either.  I had my hysterectomy & only took 2 pills.  I was fine with the advil.  Great news that your "girls" are free and clear of "that word" & you can be over that hurdle.  I am going to take one step at at time but sometimes that's easier said than done.  Best wishes to you!! And thanks for the encouragement!
Posts.Title: ADH Biopsy Surgery coming Up :-( NY_Lisa SueInMN

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2013 09:25AM NY_Lisa wrote: Biopsy is done & to tell the truth, the sterotactic biopsy I had back in January was more painful.  Not to say that the wire insertion into the area was pleasant, but it sounded much worse than it actually was.  I was put in twilight & when I woke up I hadn't even realized the procedure had taken place yet!  I was in no pain, just groggy.  I was given a script for tylenol w/coedine but didn't need to fill it.  Only took some extra stength tylenol PM before bed.  This morning I feel fine.  Believe me, my breast "knows" that something went on! It's a tiny bit tender but nothing horrible.  I almost wish I felt just a little bit worse because I know I'll be tempted to do more than I'm supposed to be.  Sitting still & relaxing is not one of my strong points!  The waiting the 3-5 days for the results will be the hardest part but I'll be very busy with work & family so hoping it will make the time pass. Thank you everyone for your encouraging words.  I'm so glad I found this forum to gather more information & get educated! I'll be back to  share my results!
Posts.Title: ADH Biopsy Surgery coming Up :-( NY_Lisa SueInMN

Posts.Content: NY_Lisa wrote: After 2 MRI's & needle biopsy's in both breasts, I head into surgical biopsy this Friday for my right breast.  I had a partial hysterectomy just 6 weeks ago so to say that I am so over these doctors poking & proding my private areas, would be an understatement!  LOL!  I've read the recovery for this procedure & I'm okay with it.  Not too thrilled about going under anethesia, but I'd rather not feel or listen to what they're doing anyway.  Here's my concern & where I'm looking for some guidance ~ I am 45, in very good general health.  The breast surgeon  recommends that I see on oncologist regardless of my results.  He said & I have read on different websites, that it is common for them to recommend that I go on tamoxifen for 5 years.  My general physician said there is no hard evidence that going on it will prevent bc.  I know I'm no there yet, but has anyone been guided to go on it?  Did you take it? How were the side effects?  Did anyone decide against it?  My mind is racing more about that decision than anything else right now.  I am scared to death that I will have a positive diagnosis & have no choice but that decision will be obvious if that were the case.
